title: PPI Working Group
text: Post-Prediction Inference (PPI) constitutes an analytical paradigm for making accurate scientific inferences when someone would like to use a pre-trained machine learning algorithm to impute for missing values, while preserving the ability to perform valid statistical inference using those imputed values.

title: PPI Working Group
text:
What is Post-Prediction Inference?
Post-Prediction Inference (PPI) constitutes an analytical paradigm for making accurate scientific inferences when someone would like to use a pre-trained machine learning algorithm to impute for missing values, while preserving the ability to perform valid statistical inference using those imputed values.

title: Publications
text:
Methods for correcting inference based on outcomes predicted by machine learning









Dec 1, 2020


Siruo Wang,Tyler H. McCormick,Jeffrey T. Leek

10.1073/pnas.2001238117
